pageContext.claim: “When you look at China, and when you look at other countries where they have foul air, they have not good air that comes over to the United States. People don't want to talk about it, but it comes over. So we're going to be clean, but they're not, and it costs a lot of money. Well, the fact is, we are absolutely clean, but we're not going to spend trillions of dollars and make it good for others but not make it good for our -- you know, I have a very simple policy.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has rolled back so many air quality regulations that researchers fear the changes could cause 80,000 more deaths per decade and the cause of respiratory problems for a million people.
